intro: Coccoloba ceibensis, commonly known as the ceiba coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often lobed and have a distinctive, almost maple-like appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, followed by edible, fleshy berries. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
